skill.name: code-review-excellence
skill.description: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foster knowledge sharing while maintaining team morale. Use when reviewing pull requests, establishing review standards, or mentoring developers.
skill.summary: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foste...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected patterns in documentation that appear concerning but are false positives. The skill is a code review guide containing examples of vulnerabilities and code patterns for educational purposes. All detected patterns (eval references, backticks, URLs, fetch calls) are documentation content, not executable code. No actual security risks found. Safe to publish.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often become bottlenecks or sources of team friction. This skill provides structured techniques for giving constructive feedback, conducting thorough reviews, and turning every review into a knowledge-sharing opportunity that improves code quality and team collaboration.
actual_capabilities: Provide structured code review frameworks with clear phases and checklists
Guide users on giving constructive, educational feedback instead of criticism
Offer language-specific review patterns for Python and TypeScript
Teach techniques for handling disagreements and difficult feedback situations
Help establish team code review standards and processes
limitations: Does not execute or analyze code directly
Provides guidance and frameworks, not automated code analysis
User must apply judgment to specific code and contexts
Requires user to provide code context for meaningful review

use_cases.title: Learning Effective Code Review
use_cases.description: New developers or team members learning how to conduct constructive code reviews that improve code quality while maintaining positive team dynamics.
use_cases.target_user: Junior developers and new team members

use_cases.title: Improving Review Processes
use_cases.description: Teams wanting to establish or improve their code review practices with systematic approaches, checklists, and feedback frameworks.

use_cases.title: Code Review Assistance
use_cases.description: When preparing for or conducting code reviews, use this skill to structure feedback, prioritize issues, and ensure comprehensive coverage.

prompt_templates.title: General Code Review Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me review this pull request. I want to: 1) Understand the overall approach and architecture, 2) Check for security issues, 3) Look for performance problems, 4) Ensure the code is maintainable. What should I focus on and what questions should I ask the author?
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new code review and wanting a structured approach

prompt_templates.title: Security-Focused Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code specifically for security issues. Check for: input validation, SQL injection risks, XSS vulnerabilities, authentication gaps, hardcoded secrets, and proper error handling. What security concerns should I raise?

prompt_templates.title: Python Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Python code for Python-specific issues like mutable default arguments, bare except clauses, correct exception handling, and Pythonic patterns. What improvements would you suggest?

prompt_templates.title: Feedback Construction
prompt_templates.prompt: I found several issues in this code. Help me construct feedback that is: specific and actionable, educational rather than judgmental, balanced with praise for what was done well, and clearly prioritized by severity.

output_examples.input: How should I give feedback on this code that has a security vulnerability?
output_examples.output:
Frame your feedback using the context-issue-solution pattern:

[Context] I noticed the payment processing logic is in the controller.

[Specific Issue] The calculateTotal() function uses string concatenation for SQL queries, which is vulnerable to injection.

[Helpful Solution] Consider using parameterized queries instead. Here's an example pattern...

output_examples.input: What are the key things to check when reviewing a pull request?
output_examples.output:
Use the 4-phase review process:

1. Context Gathering: PR description, CI status, business requirements
2. High-Level Review: Architecture, design, file organization, testing strategy
3. Line-by-Line Review: Logic correctness, security, performance, maintainability
4. Summary: Clear decision with prioritized feedback

best_practices: Review code promptly within 24 hours to maintain team velocity and show respect for the author's work
Use the sandwich method modified: context first, then specific issue, then helpful solution
Differentiate severity clearly with labels like [blocking], [important], [nit], and [praise]
anti_patterns: Nitpicking formatting issues that should be caught by linters
Being vague or unclear about what needs to change
Making feedback about the person rather than the code
Skipping positive feedback when code is done well

faq.question: What does this skill do?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance on conducting effective code reviews. It offers frameworks, checklists, and techniques for giving constructive feedback, catching bugs, and sharing knowledge.

faq.question: Can this skill analyze my code automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance on how to review code yourself. It does not execute or analyze code directly. You provide the code context and receive review guidance.

faq.question: What types of code reviews does this cover?
faq.answer: The skill covers general code reviews, security reviews, performance reviews, and includes language-specific guidance for Python and TypeScript.

faq.question: How do I give feedback that developers will accept?
faq.answer: Use constructive language, focus on the code not the person, be specific and actionable, balance criticism with praise, and offer to help implement fixes.

faq.question: How long should a code review take?
faq.answer: A thorough review of 200-400 lines typically takes 20-30 minutes. Limit continuous review to 60 minutes with breaks. Review promptly within 24 hours.

faq.question: Does this work with specific platforms like GitHub?
faq.answer: Yes. The principles apply to any review platform. The skill includes guidance on using platform features and templates effectively.
